article.headline: Buffalo 68, Elon University 67
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Calvin Cage's 3-pointer with 29 seconds left helped lift Buffalo over Elon 68-67 Wednesday night. Yassin Idbihi led the Bulls (9-1) with 21 points and 12 rebounds. Cage finished with 19 points and Roderick Middleton added 13. Middleton followed Cage's basket with a pair of free throws to make it 68-65. Elon's Montell Watson made what would have been the game-tying 3-pointer as time expired, but referees ruled Watson's foot was on the arc and the Phoenix (2-9) came up a point short. Buffalo led 32-25 at the half, but Elon opened the second half on a 9-0 run and used another 10-point run to build a six-point lead with just under four minutes remaining. Cage connected on consecutive 3-pointers that tied the game at 63-63 with 1:23 left. The Bulls, who extended their winning streak to seven games, are unbeaten at home and off to their best start since the 1962-63 season. Watson finished with 14 points. Colin Wyatt scored 13 points for Elon, while Chris Chalko had 11 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
